TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_M00040_ESTINIEN<tab>Greetings, Lord of Dravania! I believe we have something that belongs to you!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_M00050_NIDHOGG<tab>Wicked mortals! I shall melt your flesh, and turn your bones to ash!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_N00010_NIDHOGG<tab>Thou wouldst use mine own eye against me!? Time hath done naught to dilute thy kind's depravity!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_N00020_NIDHOGG<tab>I have not forgotten thee, dragoon! Mine essence claimed thee once...and shall do so again!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_N00030_ESTINIEN<tab>No, wyrm! This ends here!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_N00040_ESTINIEN<tab>You gifted my people a thousand years of suffering. Now I gift you an eternity in darkness!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00010_SYLVETREL<tab>They are ours, Lord Haldrath... The eyes of Nidhogg!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00020_HALDRATH<tab>Aye... The wyrm lies broken and my father is avenged. With the wellspring of his vitality thus denied him, Nidhogg shall not linger long in this world.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00030_HALDRATH<tab>But behold the terrible price we have paid. My sire is dead; so many brother knights slain.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00040_HALDRATH<tab>We traded our honor for the strength which now courses in our veins. And still we are forced to make such sacrifice.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00050_SYLVETREL<tab>But not in vain, my lord. Hraesvelgr is the only great wyrm left in Dravania, and he dares not leave his lair.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00060_SYLVETREL<tab>With Nidhogg's eyes in your possession, who now can challenge the might of Ishgard? Ascend the throne, and take your rightful place as the ruler of our people!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00070_HALDRATH<tab>Nay, my friend, I must forsake the mantle of king. Though Nidhogg be defeated, his wyrmling horde yet darkens the skies with wings beyond counting.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00080_HALDRATH<tab>As one who partook of Ratatoskr's strength, it shall be my penance to bear a knight's arms until death grants me leave to retire. When that day comes, no prince shall perish, but a hells-bound hunter of dragons...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00090_SYLVETREL<tab>But Lord Haldrath! What then shall become of the royal line!?

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00100_FLAVIEN<tab>Think of your people, my lord! Without a king, who will the common man turn to in his hour of need? How will he find his way without your benevolent hand to guide him?

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00110_HALDRATH<tab>I thank you, Ser Flavien and Ser Sylvetrel─for dispelling my remaining doubts. With men of such wisdom and compassion in service to the realm, 'tis plain that Ishgard has no need of a king.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00120_HALDRATH<tab>But if you must bow to the demands of tradition, you need look no further than yourselves for one worthy to wear the crown.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00130_HALDRATH<tab>Fare thee well, my brother knights...my loyal friends. On these shoulders shall I bear the weight of my father's sins; with this lance shall I repay the debt accrued through our misdeeds.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00140_SYLVETREL<tab>What cruel jest has fate played upon us...? Have we seized this desperate victory only to lose a king?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00150_FLAVIEN<tab>We can but act as our lord has bid. We few who remain must divide between us the rulership of Ishgard and her people.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00160_BRAWNYKNIGHT<tab>Not I. My oath was to Lord Haldrath, and he alone. If he is not to be king, then I would hang up my shield, as well.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00170_SYLVETREL<tab>Will you abandon us, too, ser?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00180_BRAWNYKNIGHT<tab>I would wash my hands of blood and betrayal and take up an honest trade. Mayhap I shall serve ale instead of sharpened steel...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00190_FLAVIEN<tab>We four, then...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00200_SYLVETREL<tab>Fortemps, Haillenarte, Durendaire, and Dzemael...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00210_SYLVETREL<tab>But four houses to rule all of Ishgard...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00220_FLAVIEN<tab>...And what of the throne?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00230_SYLVETREL<tab>We keep it empty. Until the day a king rises once more, we must assume the role of stewards.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_O00240_SYLVETREL<tab>We shall shape our nation anew with a history of our own making─and let the truth of this dark day die here, upon the battlefield.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00010_ESTINIEN<tab>What ails you, friend!? Are you wounded?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00020_ESTINIEN<tab>You have borne witness to history...to the culmination of the first battle with Nidhogg.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00030_ESTINIEN<tab>The legend of Ishgard's founding tells that our ancestors were led to the land of Coerthas by the valiant King Thordan.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00040_ESTINIEN<tab>In the midst of their journey, they came to a wide chasm, where they were set upon by a great wyrm─Nidhogg. A furious battle then ensued, with Thordan leading the van.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00050_ESTINIEN<tab>Though the brave king was slain defending his people, his son, Haldrath, the first Azure Dragoon, fought on undaunted...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00060_ESTINIEN<tab>And with a mighty thrust of his lance, he gouged out Nidhogg's eye, forcing the wicked creature into retreat.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00070_ESTINIEN<tab>Thus did this eldritch orb become a sacred treasure of Ishgard, lending its power to every knight deemed worthy to bear the title of Azure Dragoon.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00080_ESTINIEN<tab>A rousing tale, is it not? Would that I could still believe it. But your vision, which we must accept as immutable truth, leaves no room for doubt─save on one point.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00090_ESTINIEN<tab>If Haldrath took both of Nidhogg's eyes, then how came this eye to be lodged in the wyrm's skull?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_P00100_ESTINIEN<tab>Beneath every answer we unearth, another question lies buried...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_Q00010_ESTINIEN<tab>'Twas a fierce battle, but one I knew we would win. Your fame is well deserved, Warrior of Light. Full proud am I to have fought at your side.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_Q00020_ESTINIEN<tab>I would fain return with all swiftness to Ishgard to inform the lord commander of our triumph...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_Q00030_ESTINIEN<tab>But we must first have words with Hraesvelgr. There are parts of this tale that the wyrm has kept from us, and I would know wherefore...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_R00010_HRAESVELGR<tab>Impenitent mortals, ever seeking to bury old wrongs under new.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_R00020_HRAESVELGR<tab>I did sense the moment of Nidhogg's demise...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_R00030_ESTINIEN<tab>You mean the moment I prised your eye from his head?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_R00040_HRAESVELGR<tab>'Twould seem thou hast uncovered my secret. Aye. Unto the blinded Nidhogg did I yield one half of my strength...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00010_HRAESVELGR<tab>Nidhogg... What hath befallen thee?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00020_NIDHOGG<tab>We are undone by covetous mortals. They did take Ratatoskr's eyes...and glut their appetites upon her essence...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00030_HRAESVELGR<tab>She is slain, then? What madness hath unmade our peaceful accord!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00040_NIDHOGG<tab>Did I not warn thee, brood-brother? They have ever been untrustworthy creatures, these short-lived Elezen.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00050_NIDHOGG<tab>But thou wert enchanted by thy mortal maid. Thy folly hath cost Ratatoskr her life, and me mine eyes...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00060_HRAESVELGR<tab>Oh, my beloved Shiva... How swiftly are thy kin made bestial by their appetites.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00070_NIDHOGG<tab>Hraesvelgr. 'Twas thy blindness that did invite disaster into our lands. Surrender thee an eye to me, and let that be thy penance.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00080_HRAESVELGR<tab>Nidhogg...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00090_NIDHOGG<tab>They bested me once, but I was reckless. I shall need but a single eye to inflict enduring torment upon these traitors and every child of their line!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00100_NIDHOGG<tab>Yield to me thy strength, brood-brother!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_S00110_NIDHOGG<tab>My vengeance is begun!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00010_HRAESVELGR<tab>Thou hast borne witness to a scene from my past.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00020_ICEHEART<tab>It was yours... Your strength that sustained Nidhogg all these years...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00030_ESTINIEN<tab>Would that Haldrath had dealt the wyrm a killing blow...

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00040_HRAESVELGR<tab>When my brood-brother did appear before me, bloody and blinded, his life was all but spent. He demanded half my vigor, that he might exact his revenge upon the mortals who had wronged us.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00050_ICEHEART<tab>And so you acquiesced! You surrendered your eye to Nidhogg knowing full well the suffering he would inflict!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00060_HRAESVELGR<tab>The peace my beloved so dearly desired had been shattered by her own kin.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00070_HRAESVELGR<tab>Their treachery claimed my brood-sister's life and my brood-brother's reason! Thinkest thou thy fits of indignation will move me to remorse!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00080_HRAESVELGR<tab>Go, mortals! Take your unruly passions and leave this place... Your presence here spelleth naught but misery.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_T00090_HRAESVELGR<tab>Were it not for Shiva's soothing embrace, I would slay you where you stand. Woe betide you should the bond we share ever weaken!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00010_ESTINIEN<tab>'Twas my life's goal to slay Nidhogg, but I find there is little joy to be had in its accomplishment.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00020_ICEHEART<tab>But you have rid the world of a hate-filled creature, and ended a bloody war in so doing...

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00030_ESTINIEN<tab>I lost my family to Nidhogg's flames. And 'twas with fury in my heart that I took up the lance. Every blow I struck, I struck in the name of vengeance. We were not so different, he and I.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00040_ICEHEART<tab>I will not judge you for your deeds─I have not the right. Too many innocents have perished in the name of my “greater good.”
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00050_ESTINIEN<tab>Yet even with all that has passed, the tale is incomplete.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00060_ESTINIEN<tab>We are short a great wyrm's eye. Of the pair which Haldrath took from Nidhogg, only one is known to us─the one I bear. What, then, became of the other?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00070_ESTINIEN<tab>Why did Nidhogg, who had taken such pains to prolong the Dragonsong War, suddenly decide to hurl his entire army against the walls of Ishgard?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00080_ESTINIEN<tab>Lord Commander... Aye, the deed is done. Nidhogg is slain.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00090_ESTINIEN<tab>What? ...In the city!? A battle with whom!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00100_ESTINIEN<tab>At once, Lord Commander. Hold firm till our return.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00110_ESTINIEN<tab>Fighting has broken out in the city. Lord Aymeric was sparse with the particulars, but it seems some commoners threw open the gates to a force of heretics.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00120_ICEHEART<tab>I gave no order to attack!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00130_ESTINIEN<tab>Are we to mark the end of the Dragonsong War by spilling the blood of our own? Mayhap Hraesvelgr was right about us...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00140_ESTINIEN<tab>Let us away, Warrior of Light. The people must be saved from themselves.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00150_ICEHEART<tab>Wait! I would join you!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00160_ICEHEART<tab>There has been enough violence. I will appeal to my people in the city and make them see reason!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_U00170_ESTINIEN<tab>Come, then, Lady Iceheart. Let us write the final chapter in this damnable war.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00010_ZEPHIRIN<tab>A small army of heretics has invaded the city, Your Eminence.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00020_ZEPHIRIN<tab>But there is no cause for concern. A sizable contingent of our soldiers is already in place to repel the Dravanian assault, and the intruders will soon find themselves outnumbered and outmatched.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00030_THORDAN<tab>Our plans proceed apace, then.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00040_ZEPHIRIN<tab>Yes, Your Eminence. This unrest shall serve to feed the people's fear of the heretics and the dragons both.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00050_THORDAN<tab>And lend renewed fervor to their prayers for deliverance...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00060_THORDAN<tab>Very good. Grant our guests what time they need to sow a measure of chaos, then order the Temple Knights to crush them.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00070_ZEPHIRIN<tab>Your will be done.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00080_LAHABREA<tab>The moment is at hand?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00090_LAHABREA<tab>Excellent. All shall soon be in alignment.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_03003_V00100_LAHABREA<tab>It is time for the Bringer of Light to die.
